dt-option.name: columns.createdCell
dt-option.summary: Cell created callback to allow DOM manipulation

type.signature: createdCell( cell, cellData, rowData, rowIndex, colIndex )
type.parameter: The `tag TD` node that has been created

Cell data. If you use `-init columns.render` to modify the data, use `$(cell).html()` to get and modify the rendered data. The information given here is the original and unmodified data from the data source.
Data source object / array for the whole row
DataTables' internal index for the row
DataTables' internal index for the column

dt-option.description:
This is a callback function that is executed whenever a cell is created (Ajax source, etc) or read from a DOM source. It can be used as a complement to `-init columns.render` allowing modification of the cell's DOM element (add background colour for example) when the element is created (cells may not be immediately created on table initialisation if `-init deferRender` is enabled, or if rows are dynamically added using the API (`-api rows.add()`).
This is the counterpart callback for rows, which use the `-init createdRow` option.

example.title: Using `createdCell` manipulate the DOM with `-init columnDefs`
